page.title: 10COASTLINE
page.content: The coastline comprises of{limestone {cliffs and areas of sand, shingle and {pebble. Due to the limestone there has been over the years a large amount of quarrying on the coastline. There is evidence of worked out quarries at various points. The{cement/asbestos works to the south of Rhose which were set up to use the raw material from the quarries is no now longer used. However, the area surrounding it has developed into a small industrial estate. This house various light industries, for instance a garden fence manufacturer, vehicle salvage company etc. Further to the East and West of this site are two caravan sites which hold permanent mobile homes.
